text:
By burning fossil
fuels, we've completely

altered Earth's
atmospheric chemistry.

We've emitted so
much carbon dioxide

that natural remedies
like trees and oceans

can't cover the scope of the
problem that we've created.

We engineered our way
into climate change,
we have to engineer our way out.

Now, that process of
removing CO2 from the air

is called direct
air carbon capture.

And existing
companies that do this

require incredible amounts of
heat, which is inefficient,

and rare materials
that aren't scalable.

Carbon Vacuum is commercializing
technology developed here

at Harvard that mimics the
ocean's natural process

of absorbing CO2 using
saltwater, but at 100,000 times
the concentration.

We use only renewable
electricity,

which is much more
efficient than heat,

in an incredibly
compact package.

That sounds great
for the environment,
but where's the business?

Well, companies with
net-zero targets

realistically aren't going to
be able to completely eliminate
their emissions.

They need someone to help
them go the last mile.

And Carbon Vacuum can pull
their remaining emissions out

of the air and store
them deep underground
where they came from.
Support us in cleaning our air.
